alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 6:51PM MST until August 21 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 647 PM MST, Between 0.5 and 1.7 inches of rain have fallen across the area, and significant rises are starting to occur on Havasu Creek. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park, Hualapai Hilltop, Havasupai Reservation and Supai. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Colorado River, Heather Wash, Black Tank Wash, Pasture Wash, Havasu Creek, Coconino Wash, Little Coyote Canyon and Prairie Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
